intro: Sida ferruginea, commonly known as red ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a rough, hairy texture. Sida ferruginea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
